metadata.title: CVE-2014-1731 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
core/html/HTMLSelectElement.cpp in the DOM implementation in Blink, as usedin Google Chrome before 34.0.1847.131 on Windows and OS X and before34.0.1847.132 on Linux, does not properly check renderer state upon a focusevent, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service orpossibly have unspecified other impact via vectors that leverage "typeconfusion" for SELECT elements.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1731` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 36.0.1985.125-0ubuntu1.14.04.0~pkg1029
chromium-browser-l10n - 36.0.1985.125-0ubuntu1.14.04.0~pkg1029
chromium-chromedriver - 36.0.1985.125-0ubuntu1.14.04.0~pkg1029
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 36.0.1985.125-0ubuntu1.14.04.0~pkg1029
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 36.0.1985.125-0ubuntu1.14.04.0~pkg1029
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.0.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.0.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.0.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.0.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.0.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '36.0.1985.125-0ubuntu1.14.04.0~pkg1029').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
